title: Why Porsche, Mercedes and GM are betting on silicon-anode batteries
description: Silicon-anode batteries could be the next big thing in tech, as they start to win the attention of Airbus, Porsche Mercedes-Benz and General Motors.

title: SpaceX Starship explosion spread particulate matter for miles
description: SpaceX Starship explosion leaves researchers looking for answers about health and environmental impacts from debris and particulate emissions.

title: Johnson & Johnson to price shares of consumer spinoff Kenvue at $20 to $23 in IPO
description: J&J said it launched a roadshow for Kenvue's IPO of more than 151 million shares of common stock.

title: Microsoft-backed tech group pushes for AI regulation: Here's what it's suggesting
description: "We're an industry group that wants Congress to pass this legislation," said Craig Albright, vice president of U.S. government relations at BSA.

title: First Republic says deposits tumbled 40% to $104.5 billion in 1Q, but have stabilized since
description: The deposit flight for the regional bank was worse than Wall Street expected.

title: Apple declares 'resounding victory' after decision reached in Epic Games appeal
description: An appeals court on Monday mostly sided with Apple over its App Store rules in a suit with Epic Games.

title: NBCUniversal faces a set of company-defining decisions as CEO Jeff Shell departs
description: NBCUniversal must make decisions on Hulu, sports rights and a potential merger with Warner Bros. Discovery without CEO Jeff Shell.

title: 'Crypto is dead in America,' says longtime bitcoin bull Chamath Palihapitiya
description: Tech investor Chamath Palihapitiya, who previously claimed bitcoin has replaced gold and would eventually get to $200,000, now says "crypto is dead in America."

title: The economy is in a 'freight recession,' with China trade decline continuing
description: As ocean trade volumes continue to fall, rail and road is suffering and the supply chain is in what some executives call a 'freight recession.'

title: Tucker Carlson leaves Fox News in wake of Dominion defamation settlement
description: Fox News and Tucker Carlson have agreed to part ways, the network said.

title: Disney begins second, larger round of layoffs, bringing total to 4,000 jobs cut
description: Disney plans to reduce its workforce by 7,000 jobs as part of a larger reorganization that will see the company cut $5.5 billion in costs.

title: Social media raises bank run risk, fueled Silicon Valley Bank’s collapse, paper says
description: A new academic paper examines the risk of social media on "distress in banks" and how Twitter conversations amplified the bank run risk ahead of SVB's collapse.

title: Crypto winter is over — and bitcoin could hit $100,000 by the end of 2024, Standard Chartered says
description: The U.S. banking sector crisis has solidified the case for bitcoin as a "decentralised, trustless and scarce digital asset," Standard Chartered said in a note.

title: Russia's foreign minister comes to the United Nations as Moscow faces war crimes accusations
description: Russia's foreign minister, Sergey Lavrov, takes the helm of the UN Security Council as allegations of Russian war crimes in Ukraine mount.

title: Apple's VR headset will reportedly run hundreds of thousands of iPad apps
description: The headset, reportedly dubbed the "Reality Pro," will be compatible with hundreds of thousands of iPad apps, according to Bloomberg.

title: China says it respects ex-Soviet nations after envoy’s 'unacceptable' comments on sovereignty
description: China said Monday it respects the independency of former Soviet nations after remarks by its ambassador in France were deemed "unacceptable" in Europe.

title: Twitter grants UK far-right party Britain First 'official organization' label
description: Britain First now gets a gold checkmark on Twitter and is labelled as an "official organization."

title: Be 'a real man,' Russia tells men as it looks recruit more fighters for war in Ukraine
description: The ministry launched advertising campaigns designed to appeal to Russian men and their sense of duty and patriotism.

title: Samsung faces weakest quarter since 2009 as memory chip market in 'worst slump in decades'
description: Samsung said this month that it would report operating profit of 600 billion Korean won ($449 million) for the first quarter, its worst number in 14 years.

title: Luxury goods giant LVMH becomes the first European company to surpass $500 billion in market value
description: Luxury goods giant LVMH on Monday became the first European company to surpass $500 billion in market value.

title: Hollywood backers Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney help springboard a Welsh soccer club back into the big leagues
description: Wrexham, the Welsh soccer club owned by Hollywood A-listers Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney, secured promotion to the English Football League (EFL).

title: Brits warned they are not saving enough for retirement and face a 'risky' future
description: Workers in the U.K face a "risky" future when it comes to their pensions, according to a report released by the Institute for Fiscal Studies Thursday.

title: Credit Suisse logged asset outflows of more than $68 billion during first-quarter collapse
description: The stricken Swiss lender posted a one-off 12.43 billion Swiss franc profit for the first quarter of 2023, due to the controversial write-off of 15 billion Swiss francs of AT1 bonds by the Swiss regulator as part of its emergency takeover by domestic rival UBS.

title: Calls to move away from the U.S. dollar are growing — but the greenback is still king
description: From Brazil to Southeast Asian nations, more and more countries are calling for trade to be carried out in other currencies besides the U.S. dollar.

title: Employee surveillance is on the rise — and that could backfire on employers
description: "If the intent of surveillance is to control … then the entire basis of remote working is lost," says Randstad's managing director for Singapore and Malaysia.
